data.title: This is what Top Gun’s Kelly McGillis looks now… and you’d NEVER recognise her – The Sun
data.meta_description: IT’S been more than 35 years since the release of Top Gun, but would you recognise Tom Cruise's love interest in the film if you bumped into her?Pro
data.text:
IT’S been more than 35 years since the release of Top Gun, but would you recognise Tom Cruise's love interest in the film if you bumped into her?

Probably not.

Kelly McGillis played the flight instructor in the hit blockbuster that defined a generation, with her character falling in love with cheeky and brave fighter pilot Maverick.

The 1986 film about fighter pilots at America's combat flying school in Miramar saw Cruise playing cocky airman Pete 'Maverick' Mitchell.

It was the role that catapulted him to A-list stardom and inspired a whole generation with quotes like: "I feel the need... the need for speed."

But the film's leading lady Kelly has barely been in the spotlight since starring in the role.

The actress, now 62, has long ditched her blonde perms for a much shorter hairstyle and often wears thick glasses.

She first found fame in 1985 after starring in Witness alongside Harrison Ford, receiving Golden Globe and BAFTA nomination for her performance.

Following Top Gun, she starred opposite Jodie Forster in The Accused - a film, about the harrowing story of a woman who was gang raped, that she reportedly despised.

After appearing in dozens of television and film roles throughout the 1990s, she took a break from acting for a few years.

Her love for theatre saw her in plays like the Twelfth Night and The Merchant of Venice.

Kelly was previously married to Boyd Black and Fred Tillman, and she has two daughters, Kelsey and Sonora, from her second husband.

In 2009 she came out as a lesbian during an interview with SheWired.

The following year she entered into a civil union with Melanie Leis but they broke up five years ago. Kelly told Yahoo that she struggled with her identity and drugs for a few years before deciding to fix her life and get sober.

She moved with Leis to New Jersey, where she worked with drug addicts in a rehab facility.

The actress also volunteered to visit prisoners in a detention facility in the state.
